result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value does not Exceed $500 and Prior Burglary/Theft Conviction)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brooke A Craker

records.addlTxt:
Conditions: 
No contact with R.W. without approval of R.C.
No contact with co-defendant A.H. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

(11:19 AM cases 22CF601, 22CF724 called.) Defendant Brooke A Craker appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Karl A Schmidt appeared by video for Brooke A Craker. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaints and time limits for preliminary hearing.
Court orders the warrant is quashed.
State requests $100.00 cash bond and cites reasoning.
Court orders $5,000.00 signature bond with conditions on 22CF724 and orders bond continues on 22CF601.
Defendant updates address with the Court.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on October 24, 2022 at 3:15 pm.
Hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:

State requests warrant.
Warrant ordered in effect 07/22/2022 at 12:00 PM.
Initial appearance on July 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.

(Case called at 11:49 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Brooke A Craker not in court.  Attorney Ryan Kohler appeared by video on behalf of Attorney Katherine Cook for Brooke A Craker.  Attorney Afton Lewis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
No information for the Court as to the Defendant's non-appearance. State requests this case be rescheduled to go in to returns with other open case.
